title: Warwick Changes

embed.description: With feet pounding down Zaun's stone streets, Warwick's prey flees in desperation. The scent of blood hangs in the air, guiding the beast to his quarry. All efforts to escape are in vain. In a flash of gore-soaked fur, Warwick strikes-and his target is dead in an instant.

body:
Is it just me or does anyone else think Riot did a great job with this?

Now I realise there's not been much in the way of actual gameplay with the new {{champion:19}}, but (to me) it seems like these changes will shift his power so he's still strong but not overbearing. Probably the most notable thing (for me) is the change to his ultimate Infinite Duress which is now a skill shot rather than targeted (much needed change, in my opinion).

Discuss.

replies.body:
I mean, they have given him everything. I think as long as he remains a Lifesteal Tank and doesn't become the old, 2 damage item 1-combo insta someone, he will be really healthy and pretty cool.

His new Q and E will 10000% fix the problem with old Warwick "being useless until 6". Gap closer with a Fear. So good. You can jump behind them and fear them backwards.

Infinite Duress now needs to be aimed and can be blocked! Love it. Really keen on playing new Warwick. Might main him.....always loved the concept of high regeneration/healing fighter. (Tanky as long as you are hitting things).

Hope his clear speed isnt too low without AOE (raptors please.)

shouldn't be a problem if he can ignore raptors and just gank a lane, but if hes still a power farm to 6 get 2 items than be strong kind of guy hes going to fail in the current meta, that is unless his laning is significantly improved
I think with his new Q he will definitely be able to and should gank before level 6. I hope he can clear the jungle fast enough to be competitive.

> [{quoted}](name=Maraudaur,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=OQ0zen6y,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-01-10T23:43:10.791+0000)
>
> Infinite Duress now needs to be aimed and can be blocked!

And dodged! Don't forget dodged!
hahaha but at least he won't get executed by raptors with his high lifesteal (I hope). I see so many junglers think they can do raptors and then find out they're wrong just a little too late.

Absolutely love the way the rework is looking. His whole theme has been completely realised. To me the feel of the champ is very important and I think they nailed that in this rework, whilst adding in much needed counter play and decision making.
he seems very broken. Can see this being a perma ban.
The combination of his w and ult seem like they could be a bit over the top especially when trying to escape from ww but we will have to wait and see
The range on that ultimate jump seems quite ridiculous tho, seems like it needs to be reigned in a little. But see how it goes on the rift.
I really like it, I think Riot has outdone themselves this time!
